required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Web-based Motivational Interviewing to Increase Physical Activity Participation Among Adults

detailed_description.textblock: Increasing physical activity (PA) is a public health priority. There is preliminary support for application of Motivational Interviewing (MI) for physical activity (PA), web-applications for PA promotion, web-based MI for behavior change, and finally web-based MI for PA. Based on collective findings in these areas of inquiry, it is necessary to investigate the efficacy of MI as a method that lends readily to practical applications for PA promotion. The current study seeks to investigate whether web-based MI can be applied in an adult population to enhance PA participation using a physician referral scheme. Additionally, mechanisms of behavior change are considered in order to inform future research and intervention.

primary_outcome.description: Physical activity will be assessed using pedometers.
Physical activity will be assessed using a self-report inventory.

secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive mediators of physical activity participation including self-efficacy, readiness to change, motivation, intention, enjoyment, and decisional balance for physical activity will be assessed.

intervention.description: Participants will engage in 4 sessions of web-based motivational interviewing over the course of 4 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults referred through primary care due to insufficient physical activity standards based on Centers for Disease Control (CDC) guidelines for aerobic activity.
- Must have internet access and e-mail.
- Cleared by physician for physical activity participation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Greater than 10,000 steps per day on average based on baseline pedometer screening over the course of 7 days.
